Address: 2252 S Main St Ste 100, Ann Arbor, MI 48103
Description: A menu of customizable Mexican food served in a modern restaurant, plus takeout & catering.

summary.snippet: "2-14-24 just got carryout and experienced great service from all the staff."
"I ordered family meal and taco family dinner with chips and queso."
"Great employees and tasty food at a great price."

most_relevant.description:
I discovered a piece of glass in my meal and contacted the manager, Anthony, to address the issue. While he offered to either remake the dish or provide a refund, he implied that I was dishonest about the presence of glass in my food and suggested that I had placed it there myself.

Below are photos after spiting the food out.

Every time I go to this location, someone is standing right next to the door smoking a cigarette. The smoke not only permeates around the restaurant, but also continues to follow me into the store. The smell makes me nauseous and has been enough to make me choose a different restaurant.

The food was low quality compared to other Qdoba’s I have went to, and they gave way less than any other location ever has.

On top of all this, staff was rude and it felt like trying to rush me out the door.

Do not recommend this location, pretty much anywhere else would be a better establishment to give your money.

We had a catered order from this Qdoba for a recording session at Big Sky and they couldn't have been nicer! I needed to change an order last minute and when I called and spoke with Anthony he was so accommodating, friendly, and professional. I was so impressed by his kindness, this experience reminded me that there is hope for mankind. Also, the food is good!

Great experience today at this store. Was having quite frankly an awful day and needed lunch and the gentleman that was behind the counter (Sunday 5/26 around noon) was very upbeat and friendly. Really kind of turned my day around. Small acts of kindness and positive vibes can do that. This employee should be the standard for all restaurants. I didn’t catch his name, but you should be proud of his service.

UPDATE: They reached out to me after I posted this review and said they would give me a refund. 3 months later, I still have yet to receive any compensation. I haven't been back since this review and I will never be returning in the future. Sorry, not sorry.

Hands down this has got to be to worst experience I have ever seen with a restaurant.  Things were fine until I got to the counter to place my our order.

--------------------------------------------

The food:

First off, we were wondering why the tortillas were brown but more on that later. The cilantro rice was hard and lacking cilantro. They were out of cheese. The adobo chicken I got was hard and obviously had been sitting out too long. My wife's steak was also hard and bland. My daughter couldn't even eat her nachos. We got an extra bag of chips with the meal and when we tried to eat them were greeted with a glorious pallet watering mix of stale chips, soggy chips and some way over salted chips. Know we know why she couldn't eat her nachos.

The service:

The staff was all quite rude. They gave the impression that they were done with their shift and were mad they had to work. I'm assuming the manager wasn't on duty because it did look like there were 3 servers and a cook so I'm guessing they were understaffed. When we got to the register, I asked if the chips were warm and was given an attitude. When we asked why the tortillas were brown he said that they were wheat and they were out of flour ones. Something the first server neglected to tell us.

The atmosphere:

The walkway to the counter was clear but it was quite apparent they had not cleaned their work area at all. We were there well after the dinner rush and it was clear the person responsible for cleaning up the place was not schedule to work that night. There was food caked to the counter by the register. Finally, the garbage can was well beyond full. I didn't look at the other cans but a picture says a thousand words. Judge for yourself.

Conclusion:

We have been patrons of this qudoba for as long as they have been open in this shopping center. I have never been so disgusted as I was tonight with this establishment. When you buy food for the whole family and the bill come out to almost 50 bucks you expect better than this.  Thankfully they opened another Qdoba on the west side of ann arbor. We will NEVER be back to this location again. I suggest that the company does a surprise inspection to see what kinda of image this store is portraying before the health department does. This store would get closed down immediately.

I recommend that if you are in the mood for Qdoba to skip this place entirely and head over to zeeb road in front of Meijer. The extra time and gas spent to get there are a small price to pay to avoid this food poisoning establishment.

I love Qdoba and usually visit the Washtenaw/Huron location, which is always great. However, this time I went to the Main Street location, and it was a very different experience. The staff and the building were not up to the cleanliness standards expected for serving quality food. Two men had long hair with no covering, hanging directly over the food, and the food line was a mess. It just gave me an icky feeling eating the food when the staff didn’t seem to take cleanliness seriously.
This is my first time trying this branch and I was impressed by the employee Josh’s treatment. He is very wonderful. I appreciate his efforts.

This location seems like it's going downhill.  The food had no taste to it.  The employees hardly put any ingredients in my burrito and it's was so desolate.  Definitely will not be going to this location again.
